A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: ...oh boy. Fans of the series have many complaints about the treatment of certain characters. All of mine are purely from a storytelling perceptive. I love discussing this movie because it gets to the bottom of how people think stories dm should be told. How do you set up and properly execute a character arc? How do you give satisfying conclusions to character specific subplots? How do you get an audience invested in the relationship between a girl and her sister other than drowning them in exposition? The answers to these questions are key to understanding storytelling for the screen. This movie doesn't get them right. It looked Great though.
